info.title: awork API
info.description: This is the API documentation for awork.

get.summary: Returns the last time entry of a specified user.
get.description:
The last time entry is always the last one that was started.
            Time entries which are started in the future are ignored.
            If a time entry does not have a start time, 12.00 am is automatically assumed as the start time
            for comparison with other time entries from the same day.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be an admin or the creator.</Check>

post.summary: Pauses a running time tracking for a user.
post.description:
If there is already a paused time tracking nothing happens. If there is no running time tracking, returns NoContent.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be the creator.</Check>

post.summary: Resumes a paused time tracking for a user.
post.description:
If there is already a running time tracking nothing happens. If there is no running time tracking, returns NoContent.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be the creator.</Check>

post.summary: Starts a new time tracking for a user.
post.description:
If there is already a running/paused time tracking it will be stopped automatically in order to start the new one.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be an admin or the creator.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model describing the time tracking to start.

post.summary: Stops the currently running time tracking of the specified user.
post.description:
There is no request body necessary for this operation.
            For this operation to work there must be a running time tracking for the user.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be an admin or the creator.</Check>

get.summary: Returns all time entries of the specified project.
Returns all time entries of the specified task.

get.description:
Returns all time entries.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to get the time entry.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry (this includes external timetrackings from connected projects).
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary (this does NOT include external timetrackings from connected projects).

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">Any authenticated user.</Check>

post.description:
Creates a new time entry.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to create the time entry.
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs permissions on:
            'project-planning-data' if it is a project task.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">Any authenticated user.</Check>

get.summary: Retrieves all time entries with a simplified model based on the grouping parameter.
Get a time entry by id.

parameters.name: timeEntryId
parameters.description: The id of the time entry.

put.summary: Updates the time entry with the specified id.
put.description:
Updates the time entry with the specified id.
            Depending on the time entry, the calling users has to have several permissions to update the time entry:
            No permissions are required if the calling user is owner of this time entry.
            If the calling user is not the creator of the time entry and the time entry is connected to a project, 'write'
            permissions
            on the 'project-timetracking' feature are necessary.
            If the time entry is connected to a task, the user needs to be assignee of this task or the user needs permissions on:
            'project-planning-data' if it is a project task.
            The break duration of the time entry is kept the same. The break duration cannot be smaller than the duration of the
            time entry. To remove the breaks, use the endpoint POST /timeentries/{id}/removeBreaks.
            Following combination of times and duration are allowed for already completed time entries:
            - start time (local or utc) and end time (local or utc) (this option always takes precedence)
            - start time (local or utc) and duration
            - end time (local or utc) and duration
            For running time entries, you can only update the start time (local or utc) while the duration stays 0.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">Any authenticated user.</Check>

parameters.name: timeEntryId
parameters.description: The id of the time entry.

requestBody.description: The time entry data to update.

post.summary: Handles removing all breaks from a time entry, effectively resuming the timer.

parameters.name: timeEntryId
parameters.description: The id of the time entry.

get.summary: Returns the last time entry of a specified user.
get.description:
The last time entry is always the last one that was started.
            Time entries which are started in the future are ignored.
            If a time entry does not have a start time, 12.00 am is automatically assumed as the start time
            for comparison with other time entries from the same day.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be an admin or the creator.</Check>

post.summary: Pauses a running time tracking for a user.
post.description:
If there is already a paused time tracking nothing happens. If there is no running time tracking, returns NoContent.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be the creator.</Check>

post.summary: Resumes a paused time tracking for a user.
post.description:
If there is already a running time tracking nothing happens. If there is no running time tracking, returns NoContent.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be the creator.</Check>

post.summary: Starts a new time tracking for a user.
post.description:
If there is already a running/paused time tracking it will be stopped automatically in order to start the new one.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be an admin or the creator.</Check>

requestBody.description: The model describing the time tracking to start.

post.summary: Stops the currently running time tracking of the specified user.
post.description:
There is no request body necessary for this operation.
            For this operation to work there must be a running time tracking for the user.

<Check title="Required Permissions" icon="key">The user must be an admin or the creator.</Check>

startDate.description: The start date and time of the break in UTC. Required.

duration.description:
The duration of the break in seconds. Required when the end date is set.
When a time tracking is paused, it has at least one break with a start date and no duration or end date.

endDate.description: The end date and time of the break in UTC. Required when the duration is set and the break is finished.

Break.description: The break model. Shows when a time tracking was paused.

description.example: There is no matching path for this URL.

link.description: The link to the API documentation page.

details.description: A list of details describing the error.
example: No project with the id '123' exists.

validationErrors.description: If a validation error occurred, this contains the validation errors for each property.

traceId.description: The request trace id for tracking the request.

icon.description: The icon of the task status in a task.

Gets or sets the id of the nested model.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

hasImage.description: Whether this user has a profile image.

id.description: Gets or sets the id of the nested model.

projectKey.description:
The unique project key within the workspace (e.g., "NIKE").
Maximum 32 characters, uppercase letters, numbers, and dashes only.

hasImage.description: Whether the project has an image.

isBillableByDefault.description: Whether project times should be billable by default.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created the project.

ProjectTagModelForTimeTrackings.description:
A tag model used for the timetrackings ProjectModelForTimeTrackings.
Do not delete, we need to create copies of the tag model for each entity to avoid issues with Automapper.

id.description: Gets or sets the id of the nested model.
Gets or sets the id of the nested model.
The id of the time entry.

isBillable.description: Whether the time entry is billable or not.

isBilled.description: Whether the time entry is billed or not.

duration.description: The duration of the time entry in seconds. Not set if the time entry is still running.

startDate.description:
The start date and time of the time entry. Required.
If the time entry is date only, the time should be 00:00:00.

endDate.description:
The end date and time of the time entry. Not set if the time entry is still running.
If the time entry is date only, it should be the same as the start date.

typeOfWorkId.description: The id of the type of work.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created this time entry.

createdOn.description: The date of the creation of this time entry.

isBillable.description: Whether the time tracking is billable or not.

isBilled.description: Whether the time tracking is billed or not.

note.description: The note of the time tracking.
note.example: I created a first draft for the new sitemap

typeOfWorkId.description: The id of the type of work of the time tracking.

timezone.description:
The original timezone of the time tracking.
The format of the timezone is the IANA standard.

id.description: Gets or sets the id of the nested model.

baseType.description:
The base type of the task.
Can be 'private' for a private task or
'projecttask' for a project task.

taskIdentifier.description:
The full task identifier combining project key and task number (e.g., "NIKE-42").
Maintained by the service layer, updated when project key changes.

taskStatusId.description: The id of the status for this task.

typeOfWorkId.description: The id of the type of work of this task.

projectId.description:
The id of the project this task is assigned to.
Only set if this is a project task.
In this case, it is equal to the EntityId.

plannedDuration.description: The expected planned workload of the task, in seconds.

closedOn.description: The date the task was set to closed.

assignees.description: The list of assigned users of this task, or empty if no user is assigned.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created this task.

correlationId.description: The correlation id between parent and subtasks, meaning it's either the ParentId or its own Id.

parentId.description:
The id of the parent task this of this subtask.
Only set if this is a subtask.

id.description: The id of the task list.

createdOn.description: The date this task list was created.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created this task list.

updatedOn.description: The date this task list was last modified.

updatedBy.description: The id of the user who last modified this task list.

plannedDuration.description: The planned duration for this task list, in seconds.

totalPlannedDuration.description:
The total planned duration for this task list, including all primary tasks (parent tasks which have this tacklist as PrimaryTaskListId), in seconds.
Calculated: sum PlannedDuration of primary tasks in list
Archived task lists are not included in the calculation.

totalPlannedDurationWithHierarchy.description:
The total planned duration for this task list, including all primary tasks (parent tasks which have this task list as PrimaryTaskListId), in seconds.
Calculated: max(PlannedDuration, sum TotalPlannedDurationWithHierarchy of primary tasks in list)
Archived task lists are not included in the calculation.

isArchived.description: Whether the task list has been archived.

isHiddenForConnectUsers.description:
True if the task in this list will be not visible for external workspace users. 
False otherwise.

orderOfTask.description: The order of the task in the list.

TaskTagModelForTimeTrackings.description:
A tag model used for the timetrackings TaskModelForTimeTrackings.
Do not delete, we need to create copies of the tag model for each entity to avoid issues with Automapper.

isBillable.description: Whether the time tracking is billable or not.

isBilled.description: Whether the time tracking is billed or not.

note.description: The note of the time tracking.
note.example: I created a first draft for the new sitemap

isDateOnly.description: Whether the time entry is a date only entry.

startDate.description: The date and time when the time entry was started in UTC. Required.

endDate.description: The date and time when the time entry ends in UTC. Not set if the time entry is still running.

timezone.description:
The original timezone of the time tracking.
The format of the timezone is the IANA standard.

duration.description:
The duration of the time tracking in seconds.
Required when the time entry is not running.

typeOfWorkId.description: The id of the type of work.

userId.description:
The id of the user.
Can be null if the user was deleted.

id.description: The id of the time tracking.

breakDuration.description:
The duration of the break in seconds.
Cannot be set via API.

createdBy.description: The id of the user who created this time tracking.

createdOn.description: The date this time tracking was created.

updatedBy.description: The id of the user who last updated this time tracking.

updatedOn.description: The date this time tracking was last modified.

breaks.description: The breaks of the time tracking.

resourceVersion.description:
The version of the entity, updated on every modification, to the ticks in UTC.
Not identical to UpdatedOn.

isExternal.description: True if this entity is coming from an external workspace (awork Connect).

isBillable.description: Whether the time tracking is billable or not.

isBilled.description: Whether the time tracking is billed or not.

note.description: The note of the time tracking.
note.example: I created a first draft for the new sitemap

isDateOnly.description: Whether the time entry is a date only entry.

startDate.description: The date and time when the time entry was started in UTC. Required.

endDate.description: The date and time when the time entry ends in UTC. Not set if the time entry is still running.

The original timezone of the time tracking.

The id of the user.

tags.name: TimeEntries
tags.description:
There are some endpoints which have a V2 version. For those the V1 endpoints will be deprecated in the future.
                    Please use the V2 endpoints instead.
                    The endpoints can be used for general operations on existing time entries.
                    A time entry can be linked to a task and / or project, although it can also be created for the user themselves without any entity link.
                    If the time entry is linked to a project it is also indirectly linked to the company of that project.
                    Similarly, the time entry is automatically linked to the project of the the task.

tags.name: TimeTracking
tags.description:
The v1 versions of these endpoints will be deprecated at some point. Please migrate to the V2 versions.
                These endpoints can be used to start, stop, pause or resume a time tracking as well as to get the last time tracking of a user.
